Crimes.Legal_Issue: Was the visa officer's decision to deny permanent residence based on humanitarian and compassionate grounds reasonable?
Credibility_Assessment: Applicant's spouse did not disclose marriage prior to gaining permanent residency
Basis_of_Claim: Non-accompanying family member not examined at time of sponsorship
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Reasonableness of visa officer’s application of humanitarian and compassionate grounds
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Section 117(9)(d) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Spouse failed to disclose marriage before obtaining permanent residency
Document_Fraud: Misrepresentation in immigration documents regarding marital status
Credibility_Issues: Withholding of material information about marriage
Crimes.Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act and Regulations

Crimes.Violation_Type: Non-disclosure of material personal information in immigration process
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Is the visa officer's decision refusing the Applicant's permanent residence application based on humanitarian and compassionate grounds reasonable?
Application_Facts: Applicant's wife failed to disclose her marriage before becoming a permanent resident
Defendant_Behavior: Failure to disclose prior marriage during immigration process
Assessment_Factor: Financial and emotional dependency evaluated but found insufficient
Crimes.Applicable_Legislation: Section 117(9)(d) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Procedural_Issue: Judicial review of visa officer’s assessment
Credibility_Assessment: Negative credibility due to omission of marital status
Evidence_Used: Evidence of financial and emotional dependency
Application_Basis: Applicant barred as non-accompanying family member not previously examined
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Certification of question and overturning of refusal
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Insufficient proof of compelling humanitarian circumstances
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicant's wife did not disclose marriage when applying for permanent residency, triggering ineligibility under Section 117(9)(d)
Evidence_Handling: Visa officer reviewed available evidence on dependency
Residency_Compliance: Failure to comply with disclosure requirements for family members
Evidence_Assessment: Dependency factors assessed but not deemed sufficient
Decision_Rationale: No compelling humanitarian or compassionate reasons to override regulatory bar
